synopsis:
Droll but sensitive comedy sees an ageing and curmudgeonly office worker on the cusp of retirement discover there’s more to life than he thought after the death of his neighbour.

A pitch-perfect performance from Francisco Reyes (who provided memorable support in A Fantastic Woman) helps Martinez gain a place among cinema’s great curmudgeons. Martinez, an office worker on the cusp of retirement, whose life is one of solitary dull routine, is less than happy when he’s told to train up his enthusiastic replacement Pablo (Humberto Busto). But could the unexpected death of Martinez’s neighbour prove there’s still some life in the old dog yet? First-time director Lorena Padilla brings a sweet-natured charm and droll sense of humour to her tale of new beginnings being found in unexpected places.

Spanish with English subtitles.
starring: Humberto Busto, Martha Claudia Moreno, Francisco Reyes
